author: wsjcom
title: Wilson’s Freedoms Were Meant for Whites
text:
In Richard Norton Smith’s review of Patricia O’Toole’s new biography of Woodrow Wilson, “The Moralist: Woodrow Wilson and the World He Made” (Books, April 21), Mr. Smith mentions that Wilson “lamented the loss of wartime idealism and the erosion of economic democracy.”
But Mr. Smith’s assertion that Wilson’s name is “synonymous with liberal democracy” and “self-determination” is off the mark. Wilson must, of course, be viewed in the context of the times in which he lived, but his calls to “make the world safe for democracy”...
